intro: Cardamine bonariensis var. tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán watercress, is a herbaceous plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Bolivia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its leaves are arranged in a basal rosette and are often covered in fine hairs. The small white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom in early spring.
